    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRCubemapTexture

        public GVRCubemapTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                         Bitmap[] bitmapArray)
        Constructs a cube map texture using six pre-existing Bitmaps.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - Current GVRContext
        bitmapArray - A Bitmap array which contains six Bitmaps. The six bitmaps correspond to +x, -x, +y, -y, +z, and -z faces of the cube map texture respectively. The default names of the six images are "posx.png", "negx.png", "posy.png", "negx.png", "posz.png", and "negz.png", which can be changed by calling setFaceNames(String[]).

      • GVRCubemapTexture

        public GVRCubemapTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                         Bitmap[] bitmapArray,
                         GVRTextureParameters textureParameters)
        Constructs a cube map texture using six pre-existing Bitmaps and the user defined filters GVRTextureParameters.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - Current GVRContext
        bitmapArray - A Bitmap array which contains six Bitmaps. The six bitmaps correspond to +x, -x, +y, -y, +z, and -z faces of the cube map texture respectively. The default names of the six images are "posx.png", "negx.png", "posy.png", "negx.png", "posz.png", and "negz.png", which can be changed by calling setFaceNames(String[]).
        textureParameters - User defined object for GVRTextureParameters which may also contain default values.

    • Method Detail

      • setFaceNames

        public static void setFaceNames(java.lang.String[] nameArray)
        Set the names of six images in the zip file. The default names of the six images are "posx.png", "negx.png", "posy.png", "negx.png", "posz.png", and "negz.png". If the names of the six images in the zip file are different to the default ones, this function must be called before load the zip file.
        Parameters:
        nameArray - An array containing six strings which are names of images corresponding to +x, -x, +y, -y, +z, and -z faces of the cube map texture respectively.
